review_title: Where would I be without this place?
pros: The people at this agency care. They care about their clients and they care about their employees. I started in the children's department. They were so encouraging and understanding. They immediately put me in a special roll that lead to me deciding to finish my Masters. When I did I had the directors of the Children's department advocating for me to be hired in a Masters level position. When I started working in my current department I found my home. I adore the people I work with. They challenge me, encouragement, call me out when needed and never let me stop growing. I would trust these people with my life.
cons: It's community mental health so the pay is not the best but it is great compared to some other places

pros: Higher salaries than other mental health centers in the area.
cons: Poor management, low work life balance, nepotism

pros: make your own schedule could possibly do partial remote work
cons: management is a disaster and does not listen to your concerns overworked and underpaid no room for growth will need your own personal mental health care after working here

pros: You will get so much experience here.
cons: Nothing comes to mind that are cons.

cons: Management and clinical supervisors are horrible resulting in extremely high turnover.

pros: It’s pretty flexible and not bad to work at
Good clinical director, coworkers are fantastic, okay pay.
cons: work load is a lot. Expectations no one can meet.

pros: Clients are the best part of the job

review_title: long hours, low pay, incompetent management
pros: The electronic medical record makes it impossible for a chart to be lost of inaccessible.
cons: The pay is low and the hours are long.  Management is constantly adding to the list of tasks and responsibilities of clinicians.  The productivity expectation is unrealistic for all, but most difficult for those serving the severely and persistently mentally ill population.  There is no help from support staff, though medical staff have nurses to field their phone calls, transcriptionists for their dictation and secretaries do their scheduling.  The new office building in Derry is incredibly cold in all seasons except summer, making working conditions difficult.  The old building has not been sold but is not in use, so taxes have to be paid on that.  There is a new Transcranial Magnetic Stimulation machine that was invested in, but gets little business.  Money is spent on a full-time facilities mgr, full-time maintenance person, part-time cleaning crew, landscapers, window cleaners, and a part-time upholstery cleaner  -- quite a crew for a small, non-profit, community mental health center.

pros: Clinical staff enjoy some flexibility of schedule.  Some in supervisory positions are supportive and experienced.
cons: Some jobs are described as "35 hours per week" -- don't believe it -- figure on a minimum of 45 hrs to do all that is required!   There is a "productivity" quota to meet and mountains of required paperwork and mandatory meetings. The hours are very long for clinical staff, the pay is very low.  Benefits are not great.  The health insurance does not even cover one day surgeries!!  No raise the past year and premiums went up for health/dental.  3% match on retirement savings was dropped.  Constant IT problems to frustrate you.  Parking is problematic at times.  Individuals who worked hard their whole career at the agency have been "walked out the door" due to "budget" problems.  Climate control problems in the building.  Clinical staff pay for their own training, licensure fees and exams for licensure.

pros: The people there are great and collaborate together to ensure the best services will be provided for each client. The facility and technology being used is ahead of most other agencies. You will find the majority people are all there for the same purpose- to support and change lives!
cons: No cons. Just, like most social service jobs the pay is nothing special compared to the time and energy invested.
Like any job in mental health the compensation should be better but that is not the agencies fault. They do the best they can and really treat their employees well.
Clientele were very difficult to work with at times, scheduling was very difficult, productivity system was a challenge.
